text: Enrico Bombieri (born 26 November 1940) is an Italian mathematician. He is known for his work in analytic number theory, Diophantine geometry, complex analysis, and group theory.Proceedings of the International Congress of Mathematicians, 1974 Bombieri is a professor at the Institute for Advanced Study in Princeton, New Jersey. Bombieri won the Fields Medal in 1974 for his work in number theory and the Crafoord Prize in 2020. He was elected a foreign member of the Academia Europaea in 1995. ==References== Category:1940 births Category:Living people Category:Fields Medalists Category:Italian mathematicians Category:Italian academics Category:Members of Academia Europaea Category:People from Milan
